intro: Linanthus densiflorus, commonly known as the denseflower linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Evening Primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linanthus densiflorus is often found in disturbed areas and is considered an annual or biennial plant.
